alert.note: Alert for Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 08 at 9:12PM MST until November 09 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 6 PM MST WEDNESDAY ABOVE 6500 FEET... * WHAT...Rain, snow and snow pellets becoming all snow in the early afternoon. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 inches, with locally higher amounts above 7500 feet. * WHERE...Areas above 6500 feet, including Flagstaff, western Doney Park, Grand Canyon, North Rim and Williams. * WHEN...From noon to 6 PM MST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Southwest winds of 20 to 30 mph, with gusts as high as 50 mph, may cause areas of blowing and drifting snow, along with near zero visibility at times. Snow forecast from noon Wednesday to 6 PM Wednesday: Doney Park 0 to 1 inches Flagstaff 1 to 3 inches Grand Canyon 1 to 3 inches North Rim 5 to 8 inches Williams 1 to 3 inches
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Coconino Plateau; Grand Canyon Country; Western Mogollon Rim
